reviews.review_msg: I have taken 2 courses with Endre. He's great at presenting a topic from various angles and making everyone understand all the relevant issues. I was very satisfied with the topics of discussion in this course.

Amazing class! Endre is definitely one of the best professors at SFU. Have also taken 467 and 344 with him and he has been fantastic in all 3. Great at getting students interested and engaged, great lecturer, and gives helpful feedback. Genuinely cares about his students and very willing to meet outside of class.
Very confusing prof, with no structure to the lectures. Be aware.

Very patient and helpful. He really cares about his students, and also very passionate about the subject. Sometimes he talks a lot about his attitude/understanding towards the material, which is very helpful cuz it makes the reading a lot earier to understand from a different perspective. The course itself is hard tho. Super abstract/dense readings

Sam is a great teacher. He is intelligent, kind, helpful, and interesting. He has an excellent grasp of the material, and you will learn a lot. Thant being said, he does expect hard work: do your readings (at least once), come to class prepared to learn and you will do fine. He is a bit of a tough marker--no easy marks in philosophy.
Won't give you an A+ unless your paper is "publishable."  Hasn't published many papers herself...
Her lectures are extremely helpful, she makes it really easy to understand the material covered. The final was super easy.

Interesting story: the first essay I worked myself silly, got it proofread by my friend, and think it was one of the best papers I wrote (I'm an A-student, mind). Got a B-.  (Lowest EVER on a philosophy essay.)  For the midterm: hardly studied, spewed BS on the questions, my answers were vague and disjointed.  Got a B+.  Hmmm.

Wow, I thought that 320 was great.  Don't know what that previous person was talking about.  If you haven't done the reading, you might find that she moves too quickly.  Aside from that, it was great and so was she!  Very interesting course!
Disorganized, unclear, unhelpful, went too fast...did everything a good professor doesn't.

I usually don't leave horrible reviews. Granted, his lectures were average and his readings weren't terrible. But he was a disaster at marking. I ended up going to the Department Chair because he failed to hand me back any of my grades for the five course components, and didn't respond to any of my emails. I still never got a final grade from him.

She is very helpful when it comes to understanding the material. She asks if anyone is clear or not after each point she makes. She will also take the time to answer parts that you don't understand after class time. Very good prof. I will definitely take her again! And she makes good cupcakes!
